TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and resides in the town of GPE , GPE region , GPE .

CARDINAL . The applicant instituted proceedings in the ORG of Donetsk Region against the “ ORG CARDINAL ( Шахта CARDINAL « Новогродівська » ) - a ORG - owned enterprise - to recover salary arrears and other payments due to her late husband .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG found in favour of the applicant ( ORG міського суду PERSON області ) and awarded her ORG CARDINAL,CARDINAL.CARDINAL . The decision was sent for enforcement to the ORG ( ORG виконавчої служби PERSON міського управління юстиції ) . However , the decision was not enforced , allegedly due to the failure of ORG to act , in not selling the property of ORG .

CARDINAL . NORP In DATE the applicant instituted proceedings in the ORG of GPE against the Novogrodivskyy Town Bailiffs ' Service for failure to enforce the court decision in her favour . On DATE ORG rejected the applicant 's claim , finding no fault had been committed by ORG . The court stated that ORG had acted properly in enforcing the decision of DATE . However , by a number of decisions of ORG of GPE , ORG had been prohibited from selling the property of ORG , due to the bankruptcy proceedings which had been initiated against the company . Also on DATE , the ban on the forced sale of assets belonging to undertakings in which the ORG holds PERCENT of the share capital was entrenched in the PERSON on the Introduction of a Moratorium on the Forced Sale of Property . On DATE ORG upheld the decision of the first instance court . On DATE the ORG of GPE rejected the applicant 's appeal in cassation against the decision of DATE as submitted too late . On DATE ORG upheld this ruling .

CARDINAL . The Government submitted that in DATE the debtor requested the ORG to review the judgment of DATE in light of new circumstances . No further information was provided by the parties . In particular , the applicant stated that she was completely unaware of these proceedings .
CARDINAL . According to the applicant , by DATE she received ORG CARDINAL ; the rest of the debt due to her remains unpaid .
CARDINAL . The relevant domestic law is summarised in the judgment of ORG v. GPE ( no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , § CARDINAL , DATE ) .
